revised_title: Heat Conduction in Highly Rarefied Air: An Investigation by William Crookes
tldr: This study examines the transfer of heat in highly rarefied air and finds that heat conduction is almost independent of pressure. The author also suggests that at high exhaustions, the mean length of path between molecular collisions becomes comparable with the diameter of the case, leading to a notable fall in the rate at which heat is conveyed from the case to the thermometer.
